channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: 32 Palestinians killed trying to reach food distribution hubs, Gaza authorities say
item.description: Palestinians were shot dead during a food distribution on Saturday at a center run by a U.S.- and Israeli-backed group in southern Gaza, hospital officials said.
item.content:encoded:
Palestinians were shot dead during a food distribution on Saturday at a center run by a U.S.- and Israeli-backed group in southern Gaza, hospital officials said.

(Image credit: Mariam Dagga)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Examining the role of men in the gender gap in American society
item.description: The latest season of the podcast "Unsettled" from Iowa Public Radio looks at how gender affects people's everyday lives.
item.content:encoded: The latest season of the podcast "Unsettled" from Iowa Public Radio looks at how gender affects people's everyday lives.

item.title: Police are investigating a man's death after he was pulled into MRI machine
item.description: New York police said the 61-year-old man was wearing a large metal chain that caused him to be "drawn into the machine." The FDA warns that MRI scan create a "strong, static magnetic field."
item.content:encoded:
New York police said the 61-year-old man was wearing a large metal chain that caused him to be "drawn into the machine." The FDA warns that MRI scan create a "strong, static magnetic field."

(Image credit: Keith Srakocic)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: A surprise twist in the Trump administration's use of third country deportations
item.description: Chris Camponovo, a former State Department lawyer, examines what a multi-national prisoner swap says about the Trump administration's third country deportation strategy.
item.content:encoded: Chris Camponovo, a former State Department lawyer, examines what a multi-national prisoner swap says about the Trump administration's third country deportation strategy.
item.dc:creator: Sacha Pfeiffer

item.title: Reporting on family separation and aggressive immigration enforcement in Florida
item.description: Behind the scenes with NPR's reporting on how Florida has become the scene of some of the Trump administration's most aggressive immigration enforcement efforts.
item.content:encoded: Behind the scenes with NPR's reporting on how Florida has become the scene of some of the Trump administration's most aggressive immigration enforcement efforts.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: Tourist boat capsizes during a thunderstorm in Vietnam, leaving 34 dead
item.description: A boat carrying tourists capsized during a sudden thunderstorm in Vietnam on Saturday afternoon during a sightseeing excursion, killing 34 people.
item.content:encoded:
A boat carrying tourists capsized during a sudden thunderstorm in Vietnam on Saturday afternoon during a sightseeing excursion, killing 34 people.

(Image credit: AQDND)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump calls for the release of Jeffrey Epstein grand jury testimony
item.description: Attorney General Pam Bondi has filed a formal request to release grand jury testimony related to Jeffrey Epstein. But the president continues to distance himself from the late, disgraced financier.
item.content:encoded:
Attorney General Pam Bondi has filed a formal request to release grand jury testimony related to Jeffrey Epstein. But the president continues to distance himself from the late, disgraced financier.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: Anastasia Tsioulcas

item.title: 'Wait Wait' for July 19, 2025: With Not My Job guest James Gunn
item.description: This week, Wait Wait is live in Chicago with host Peter Sagal, special guest James Gunn and panelists Paula Poundstone, Adam Burke, and Bobcat Goldthwait
item.content:encoded:
This week, Wait Wait is live in Chicago with host Peter Sagal, special guest James Gunn and panelists Paula Poundstone, Adam Burke, and Bobcat Goldthwait

(Image credit: Maya Dehlin Spach)

item.title: Man whose car struck crowd outside LA club, injuring 30, was shot, attacked by crowd
item.description: A vehicle rammed into a crowd of people waiting to enter a nightclub along a busy boulevard in Los Angeles early Saturday, injuring 30 people and leading bystanders to attack the driver, authorities said.
item.content:encoded:
A vehicle rammed into a crowd of people waiting to enter a nightclub along a busy boulevard in Los Angeles early Saturday, injuring 30 people and leading bystanders to attack the driver, authorities said.

(Image credit: Damian Dovarganes)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Opinion: Farewell, equid program
item.description: The U.S. Army announced that 141 of its 236 horses, donkeys, and mules will be put up for adoption, in a move it says will save about $2 million dollars.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. Army announced that 141 of its 236 horses, donkeys, and mules will be put up for adoption, in a move it says will save about $2 million dollars.

(Image credit: Mark Wilson/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon
